page.title: 14The School:Great Bromley
page.content: {St. Georges Primary School}was opened on June 27th{1863}. It was extended in 1960.{100 children}attend between the ages of 5 & 11.They come in from the surrounding parish of Gt. Bromley.St.Georges{Church}plays an important part in the welfare of the school.The church & parents buy additional books,pens & even a T.V. There are{4}teaching{staff},including the Headmistress,who teach all types of subjects,from reading to science. Every class uses the computer at some time.The Rector from the church comes once a week to talk to all the pupils in assembly. School begins at 8.45a.m & ends at 3.00 p.m.The children have a one hour break for lunch.This may be sandwiches brought from home or hot food bought at school.The children walk,cycle or come by car to school.
